topic.title: Post Expansion Tasks
topic.shortdesc: Once the expansion is completed, you must perform different tasks depending on your environment.

body.p: To clean up after expanding the Greenplum cluster, remove the expansion schema.

You can safely remove the expansion schema after the expansion operation is complete and verified. To run another expansion operation on a Greenplum system, first remove the existing expansion schema.

ol.li: Log in on the master host as the user who will be running your Greenplum Database system (for example, gpadmin).
Run the gpexpand utility with the -c option. For example:$ gpexpand -cSome systems require you to press Enter twice.

body.p: If you are using PXF in your Grenplum Database cluster, you must perform some configuration steps on the new hosts.
There are different steps to follow depending on your PXF version and type of installation.

ul.li: If you installed the PXF 5.x rpm on your Greenplum cluster, you must install the same version on the new hosts.
Once PXF is installed on the new segment hosts, log into the Greenplum Master and run the following commands:pxf cluster reset plx cluster init
If you installed the PXF 6.x rpm on your Greenplum cluster, you must install the same version on the new hosts.
Once PXF is installed on the new segment hosts, log into the Greenplum Master and run the following commands: pxf cluster register plx cluster sync
